questions.question_text: What is used in JSON to represent a Python tuple?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
JSON has only two datatypes objects and arrays tuples should be arrays

Selected Answer: C
array, can be easily be verified:

$python
>>> import json
>>> json.dumps((1, 2))
'[1, 2]'

Selected Answer: A
A tuple is a collection which is ordered and unchangeable.

https://www.w3schools.com/python/python_tuples.asp

comments.content: sorry didn't read correctly the answer is indeed C

questions.question_text: What is a principle of Infrastructure as Code?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C. 'It Encourages Repeatable Processes'

Principles of Infrastructure as Code:
- Systems Can Be Easily Reproduced
- Systems Are Disposable
- Cattle, Not Pets
- Systems Are Consistent
- Processes Are Repeatable
- Design Is Always Changing

Source: https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/infrastructure-as-code/9781491924334/ch01.html

choices.D: It requires the use of large components.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer 'D' is correct. See "Cloning an Existing Repository" on https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Basics-Getting-a-Git-Repository

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer must improve the fabric discovery process in a data center. The engineer wants to check current ACI scripts in the myproject repository and clone them to a folder named aci. The engineer will optimize the scripts from the new folder. Which command performs this task on the Git repository?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agree with answer D

Selected Answer: D
Answer D is correct. The syntax for the specified action is "git push <remote> <branch>"

Source: https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/syncing/git-push

questions.question_text: A developer improves the code repository to clean a bug on the custom network monitoring application. The developer adds the changes to the staging area and then commits on the local branch. Which command pushes commits that are made on a local branch to the remote repository?
